headline: Global Edmonton honoured for breaking news coverage with 2023 RTDNA Prairie Regional Award - Edmonton | Globalnews.ca

annotations.paragraph: Global Edmonton has received an accolade through the 2023 RTDNA Prairie Regional Awards for its breaking news coverage of a deadly stabbing that had members of a northeast Edmonton neighbourhood caught in a lockdown for hours.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces the award received by Global Edmonton for its breaking news coverage, which is directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: On Thursday, RTDNA Canada announced Global Edmonton had won the Breaking News (Large Market) award in the video category for its coverage of what police said they believed was a random attack in Edmonton’s Homesteader neighbourhood.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the award and the incident covered, contributing to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: Global Edmonton crews rushed to the scene on Sept. 7, 2022 after learning of a serious stabbing attack that forced area residents to stay in their homes for several hours.
annotations.reason: This paragraph gives narrative progression by describing the actions taken by Global Edmonton during the incident.

annotations.paragraph: Police later revealed 38-year-old Brian Berland, one of three victims who were injured in the violent incident, died of his injuries.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides important factual information about the outcome of the incident covered by Global Edmonton.

annotations.paragraph: Police said a man stabbed a woman at a bus stop and then went into a nearby wooded ravine before stabbing another woman in a tent. They said investigators believe the man then left and fatally stabbed Berland multiple times.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers detailed context about the sequence of events in the incident, which is relevant to the coverage.

A total of eight schools in the area “went on alert” as a precaution as police searched for the suspect, with students being kept inside until the situation was resolved at about 5:30 p.m.
